learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate ethical andprofessional behaviour and decision-making consistent with physiotherapy standards and client rights.
Demonstrate effective communication using verbal, non-verbal, and written skills in interactions with clients, colleagues, and the community.
Plan and implement safe, effective, evidence-based, and systematic client-centred assessments and re-assessments.
Apply clinical reasoning to develop hypotheses, determine outcomes, prioritise problems and plan client-centred care.
Collaborate with clients, family and relevant health professionals to set goals and support self-management to enhance their health and well-being.
Plan, implement and progress safe, evidenced-based physiotherapy interventions for client-centred care.

assessments.task_description:
Continuous assessment of performance in neurological simulations, and completion of neurological patient workbook. Perspectives will be provided throughout the week by Clinical Educators and Stream Coordinator, related to: professionalism, communication, safety, clinical reasoning, knowledge and skills, as demonstrated though performance in SP interactions (including pre and post activities) and workbook responses. 

Individual weekly stream allocations can be found on Learn.UQ (Bb).

Submission of Workbook items is required by 12pm on the Friday of this stream.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please follow instructions from the Course Coordinator for submission of assessment items.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
